meta_data.title: Reconstructed Faith // Why Believe the Bible // Hebrew Bible Canonization

That will really bake your noodles. The fact that that we have our Hebrew scriptures are often

I mean, we actually have citations of Paul quoting the Hebrew scripture or Matthew quoting

that goes back to actual analysis with the whole other conversation. So that's this, we're talking

what we call, what we call the holy Bible that Christians have the first about two thirds of it
is the Hebrew scripture. Yes. And let's take just a second. I know we'll want to talk more about

I feel like 85, 90% of the time it is Hebrew scripture. Probably the vedicus. Yeah. And often

atheism, the road to atheism is paved by people who actually read their Bibles. Right. So that
the argument going on now is if you read your Bible, you won't believe in your Bible anymore.
Right. Because we've all disagreed to it, kind of like a user agreement on your software. Like,
oh, sure, sure, sure. Yeah, yeah. I believe it. But you don't actually know what you believe. So,
or you've never read it. So what were your questions when you were Chris Driver? Yes.
What would you always ask that was, so I had three questions. Question one was, so they would have

the arguments. I get it. And, um, that was a early, early on, even with Smalley, I told him like,
I feel like I need to coach you on some of your atheist arguments. I have better, I have better

the point being the way we handle the Hebrew scripture as is something that is fulfilled.

So you broke up with her as your girlfriend also. Well, when she became your fiance,

Thank you for joining us for this episode of Reconstructed Faith.
If you enjoyed what you heard or were challenged, please leave us a review. It'll help other people
